basics.name: Dan Hulton
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: A full stack software developer and team lead of nearly twenty years.

work.name: Workday
work.description: Workday is a suite of leading-edge HR and Finance tools, and a platform designed to elevate humans and supercharge work.  With tens of thousands of employees, offices across the globe, and a spot on the 2024 Fortune 500 list, Workday is a huge enterprise company, successfully serving other huge enterprise companies.
highlights: Hired as part of Evisort acquisition
Continued growth in Python and Typescript as we integrated Evisort services with greater Workday ecosystem
Lead the team that built the Evisort-Workday SSO/Auth integration

work.name: Evisort
work.description: Evisort is an AI-based contract intelligence and document management system for lawyers and other legal folks.  Created back before 'AI' just meant 'LLMs', Evisort had an in-house team of data scientists and machine-learning specialists that positioned them to lead the AI revolution and resulted in them getting acquired by Workday, a real recognition of their leadership.
work.summary: At Evisort, I quickly developed a reputation for professionalism and quality.  I advocated for, built, and improved internal tooling that significantly improved developer QoL and speed of delivery. Before the acquisition by Workday, I had been nominated as a Workstream Lead, in charge of the technical planning and development management of a half-dozen services.
highlights: Wrote the Evisort local development CLI
Rewrote a struggling Java service to TypeScript in 3 weeks
Known for advocating for quality and professionalism
Chosen as Workstream Lead for a half-dozen services
Joined Workday as part of Evisort acquisition

work.name: Joist
work.description: Joist is a web and mobile app for contractors to help run their business.  It covers the entire project lifecycle, from estimation to payment, in one app, and significantly simplifies the process of running your own contracting business.
work.summary: While my title was Sr. Platform Engineer, it could also have been Sr. Problem Solver.  From physical infrastructure to software infrastructure, I was the go-to guy for getting things fixed.
highlights: Resolved long-standing wifi connectivity issue affective office as one of my first tasks, and improved physical office security
Overhauled Jenkins scheduler service and improved test times significantly, vastly decreasing deploy times
Initiated work-from-home preparedness program in advance of Covid-19 lockdowns being implemented

work.name: Panvista
work.description: Panvista Mobile was an early entrant in the custom mobile app creation space, aiming to make having and maintaining your own mobile app be as easy as having and maintaining a WordPress site.  It also invested heavily into the at-the-time new beacon technology, enabling Panvista app customers to set RFID beacons around their events or spaces to trigger location-based promotions or track customer flow to better optimize their experiences.  Panvista is defunct these days, and the domain has been taken over by a shady keyword squatter.
work.summary: My primary role of responsibility was improving the app management system, improving customer experience by adding additional methods of app customization and design.  My biggest accomplishement was a large refactor of the application to support a theming system, allowing users to change the entire design of the app with a couple of clicks, as opposed to the manual per-page selections that were required before.
highlights: Significant part of the in-app beacon management system
Brought a high level of care and professionalism to a codebase that was in need of refactoring
